Articles.Content:
So we don\'t have multiplayer (or even persistence) yet, but I was inspired by this challenge to try to land multiple landers on the Mun, take a screenshot and pretend I was playing multiplayer.

I\'ll start off setting the bar low, with two whole landers on the surface. How many can you do?

Since we\'re pretending it\'s multiplayer, there\'s bonus points for having them all look unique and sciencey. Feel free to mix up as many parts packs as you can handle without killing the load screen! Landing rovers, habitats, telescopes etc will also gain massive respect. 'Cheat parts' will not gain respect. Capsule parts modified into ASAS modules or whatever for stackability and so that each lander looks legit it is totally acceptable, though not required.

If we\'re counting fallen over landers and bits of landers that survived lithobraking then the record would be 2.5, that blob on the right is part of the same lander above just slightly more exploded!

Not sure if the lack of replies is because it looks too boring or too hard...

I\'m going with too hard.
yes, tooo hard, i cant even land on the mun!
I love this idea! It really shows the \'slap-dash\' style of KSP. I can imagine several different programs working against each other. One sleek N.A.S.A style craft... My cobbled together lander...

I love this idea! It really shows the \'slap-dash\' style of KSP. I can imagine several different programs working against each other. One sleek N.A.S.A style craft... My cobbled together lander...

Thanks! I feel the same way. I think it\'d be great to see the plywood flyer with cardboard rocket landed next to a really sleek capsule design like the one AVK has in the works.

Also, success! Three is now the number to beat.
